Name: Robert K. Woelfel
Description:
Robert was shot twice with a shotgun by Harold C. Maass, 77. Maass reportedly had a thought pattern that "the world would be a better place if more people were shot" and was subsequently convicted of second-degree intentional homicide.

> JEFFERSON - Bond was set at $100,000 cash Friday for an elderly Town of Ixionia man accused of fatal shooting a 48-year old insurance [trans person] who was dressed as a woman outside [their] home.
>
> Jefferson County Cirnu Judge Alvik said a preliminary hearing for Hardold C. Masss, 77, would be held within three weeks.
>
> Maass was charged Thursday with first degree intentional homicide in the death of Robert K. Woelfel of Waukesha. Woelfei was shot at least twice with a shotgun following an argument on the Maass' property, Jefferson County sheriff Orval Quamme [said].
>
> Woelfel was still alive when deputies arrived on the scene after I p.m. Wednesday, but died a short time later, Quamme said.
>
> Two of Wolfel's sutta sand they idea why their [parent] was at the Maass' home or why [she] was wearing women's clothing, including nylons and high-heeled shoes.
> 
> Dist. Atty. Linda Larson said Fri day that Woelfet had a propensity for dressing in drag.
>
> According to the coumy coroner's report, Wortfel died of gunshot wounds to the back. head and neck areas.
>
> Court records show Maass pleaded guilty in 1963 to a change of endangering another's safety by reckless conduct in the handling of a firearm. Records indicted Maass shot his brother and served 30 days in the county jail for the offense. At Friday's hearing Larson said Maass had a thought pattern that "the world would be a better place if more people were shot."
